intro: Rosa × dumetorum decalvata, commonly known as the common dog玫瑰, is a hybrid species within the rose family. It is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and thorny stems. The plant produces small, pink to white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets. This species is native to Europe and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
